article_title: Springfield doctor pens novel on health care nightmare

article_metadata.description: In Dr. Richard Brown's fictional America, physicians are dedicated to taking patients' lives — involuntarily, if necessary — rather than saving them once the government has decided it no longer makes statistical sense to use valuable health care resources for the old or the sick.The scenarios he describes in his 230-page book, "The Kevorkian Oath," may be unlikely in today's world.
